title: Program Catalog Chemical Engineering
slu_vision_mission: We envision Saint Louis University as an excellent missionary and transformative educational institution zealous in developing locally responsive, globally competitive, and empowered human resources who are creative, competent, socially involved, and imbued with Christian spirit.

school.name: School of Engineering and Architecture
school.vision_mission: The School of Engineering and Architecture (SEA) envisions herself as an exemplary educational institution for engineering and architecture dedicated to elevating instruction, research, and extension to a higher level of competence and creativity committed to shaping the socio-technical environment founded on Christian values.

program_educational_objectives: Demonstrate technical competence in the analysis of problems and design of systems, considering all dimensions (technical, professional, societal, environmental, economic, and ethical).
Apply their talents and potentials in the practice of their profession, guided by Christian values.
Uphold honesty, service, dedication, and a deep sense of moral responsibility.
Pursue advanced education, research, and creative efforts in science and technology.
Participate actively in addressing social, technical, and business challenges for national progress.
program_learning_outcomes: Apply knowledge of mathematics, natural sciences, and engineering fundamentals to complex problems.
Conduct investigations using research-based knowledge and methods.
Design systems, components, or processes with considerations for health, safety, culture, society, and the environment.
Work effectively in diverse and multidisciplinary teams.
Analyze complex engineering problems using principles of mathematics and sciences.
Apply ethical principles and commit to professional ethics.
Communicate effectively with engineering and non-engineering audiences.
Evaluate the sustainability and societal/environmental impact of engineering solutions.
Engage in independent and life-long learning.
Assess societal, health, safety, legal, and cultural issues in engineering.
Use modern engineering and IT tools effectively, acknowledging their limitations.
Apply knowledge of engineering management and economics in team and project settings.
Practice Christian values in their personal and professional life.

materials_science_and_engineering: Instrumental Methods of Chemical Analysis (Lec & Lab)

undergraduate_freshmen: Must pass the SLU-CEE and qualify for the course.
SLU-CEE held Oct–Dec, admissions start mid-April.
transfer_students: Qualifying Exam, Personality Test, and Interview required.
Foreign transfers must take English Proficiency Test (EPT).
graduate_program_students: Must have the appropriate baccalaureate/master’s degree.
EPT required for non-native English speakers.
foreign_students: Apply 6 months before the academic term.
Must take EPT and other admission exams.

BS_Chemical_Engineering.note: Fees are per semester and subject to change.
